name: 60 Vector Shapes: Default set
description: 60 vector shapes for use in Photoshop, Fireworks and Illustrator. A simple, clean set of icons which you may like to use as your default palette. Great for mock-ups or final designs alike, they scale down well and include many of the icons we use on a regular basis in web and app design. The download includes: readme.txt file Simple installation instructions. .csh file for Photoshop So they can be imported as a set that appear in your shapes palette. .png file for Fireworks A layered file which, when imported into your symbols palette, makes all icons readily available. .eps file for Illustrator Just as you would expect, open and voila. Non-sale price: $39

name: 13 Vector Shapes: Ecommerce Add-on
description: 13 vector shapes for use in Photoshop, Fireworks and Illustrator. An add-on to the Default set – A simple, clean set of ecommerce themed icons. name: 48 Pixel Patterns
description:
A set of 48 pixel patterns to be used with Photoshop or Fireworks. The download includes: 2 .pat files (Photoshop) 48 pixel patterns: 48 black / 48 white on transparent. One file is the default size, the other is double the size (@2x) for your iOS retina designs. 2 .mpx files (Fireworks) 48 pixel patterns: black on transparent One file is the default size, the other is double the size (@2x) for your iOS retina designs. 2 .PDFs Ps & Fw installation and reference guide
A little extra help… I was asked by a developer how exactly to use the patterns in an effective and subtle way — so I put together a quick Photoshop guide
